case-studies/gitops.title: Overview of GitOps
case-studies/gitops.description: This section will introduce how to use KubeVela in GitOps area and why.

case-studies/jenkins-cicd.description: This section will introduce how to use KubeVela with existing CI tools such as Jenkins and why.

case-studies/multi-cluster.title: Multi Cluster Application
case-studies/multi-cluster.description: KubeVela is by design a full functional Continuous Delivery (CD) platform with fine grained support for hybrid/multi-cloud/multi-cluster deployment.

cli/vela_env_ls.title: vela env ls
cli/vela_env_ls.description: List environments for vela applications to run.

cli/vela_install.title: vela install

cli/vela_port-forward.title: vela port-forward
cli/vela_port-forward.description: Forward local ports to container/service port of vela application.

cli/vela_show.title: vela show
cli/vela_show.description: Show the reference doc for a component, trait or workflow.

cli/vela_uninstall.title: vela uninstall

cli/vela_workflow_rollback.title: vela workflow rollback

contributor/cli-ref-doc.title: Update Reference Docs
contributor/cli-ref-doc.description: This guide is an introduction of how to generate docs automatically from Golang scripts.

contributor/code-contribute.title: Code Contribution Guide
contributor/code-contribute.description: You will learn the following things in the code contribution guide:

contributor/code-conventions.title: Code Conventions
contributor/code-conventions.description: In this section, you will find the code conventions for all kinds of code KubeVela project related. It's not necessary to learn all of them at once, but make sure you have read corresponding parts before you start to code.

contributor/non-code-contribute.title: Non-code Contribution Guide
contributor/non-code-contribute.description: You can pick up any of the following ways you're interested to contribute.

contributor/overview.title: Developer Overview
contributor/overview.description: The developer guide including two parts:

contributor/release-process.title: Release Process And Cadence
contributor/release-process.description: KubeVela is being developed using the following process:

developers/cap-center.title: Managing Capabilities
developers/cap-center.description: In KubeVela, developers can install more capabilities (i.e. new component types and traits) from any GitHub repo that contains OAM definition files. We call these GitHub repos as Capability Centers.

developers/check-logs.title: Check Application Logs
developers/check-logs.description: It will let you select the container to get logs from. If there is only one container it will select automatically.

developers/check-ref-doc.title: The Reference Documentation Guide of Capabilities
developers/check-ref-doc.description: In this documentation, we will show how to check the detailed schema of a given capability (i.e. workload type or trait).

developers/config-app.title: Configuring data/env in Application
developers/config-app.description: vela provides a config command to manage config data.

developers/config-enviroments.title: Setting Up Deployment Environment
developers/config-enviroments.description: A deployment environment is where you could configure the workspace, email for contact and domain for your applications globally.

developers/extensions/set-autoscale.title: Automatically scale workloads by resource utilization metrics and cron

developers/extensions/set-metrics.title: Monitoring Application
developers/extensions/set-metrics.description: If your application has exposed metrics, you can easily tell the platform how to collect the metrics data from your app with metrics capability.

developers/extensions/set-rollout.title: Setting Rollout Strategy
developers/extensions/set-rollout.description: Note: rollout is one of the extension capabilities installed from cap center,

developers/extensions/set-route.title: Setting Routes
developers/extensions/set-route.description: The route section is used to configure the access to your app.

developers/learn-appfile.description: A sample Appfile is as below:

developers/port-forward.description: Once your web services of the application deployed, you can access it locally via port-forward.

end-user/components/cue/webservice.description: Service-oriented components are components that support external access to services with the container as the core, and their functions cover the needs of most of he microservice scenarios.

end-user/components/more.title: Needs More
end-user/components/more.description: KubeVela is programmable, it can be extended easily with definition. You have the following ways to discover and extend the platform.

end-user/components/ref-objects.description: This section requires you to know the basics about how to deploy multi-cluster application with policy and workflow.

end-user/debug/health.title: Aggregated Health Probe
end-user/debug/health.description: The HealthyScope allows you to define an aggregated health probe for all components in same application.

end-user/gitops/fluxcd.description: In this section, we will introduce how to use KubeVela to deliver in GitOps mode.

end-user/overview-end-user.description: Here are some workitems on the roadmap

end-user/policies/apply-once.title: One-time delivery
end-user/policies/apply-once.description: By default, the KubeVela controller will prevent configuration drift for applied resources by reconciling them routinely. This is useful if you want to keep your application always having the desired configuration in avoid of some unintentional changes by external modifiers.

end-user/policies/envbinding.title: Multi-Environment
end-user/policies/envbinding.description: This documentation will introduce how to use env-binding to automate multi-stage application rollout across multiple environments.

end-user/policies/gc.title: Garbage Collect
end-user/policies/gc.description: By default, KubeVela Application will recycle outdated resources when new version is deployed and confirmed to be healthy. In some cases, you may want to have more customized control to the recycle of outdated resources, where you can leverage the garbage-collect policy.

end-user/policies/health.title: Health Check
end-user/policies/health.description: This documentation will introduce how to use health policy to apply periodical

end-user/quick-start-cli.title: Deploy First Application
end-user/quick-start-cli.description: Welcome to KubeVela! In this guide, we'll walk you through how to install KubeVela, and deploy your first simple application.

end-user/traits/ingress.title: Gateway for Public Access
end-user/traits/ingress.description: The gateway trait exposes a component to public Internet via a valid domain.

end-user/traits/more.description: * Refer to All Trait References for all other trait types.

end-user/traits/rollout.description: In this section, we will introduce how to canary rollout a container service.

end-user/traits/service-binding.title: Binding Configuration and Secrets
end-user/traits/service-binding.description: Service binding trait will bind data from Kubernetes Secret to the application container's ENV.

end-user/traits/sidecar.title: Attaching Sidecar
end-user/traits/sidecar.description: The sidecar trait allows you to attach a sidecar container to the component.

end-user/workflow/built-in-workflow-defs.title: Built-in WorkflowStep Type
end-user/workflow/built-in-workflow-defs.description: This documentation will walk through all the built-in workflow step types sorted alphabetically.

end-user/workflow/component-dependency-p.title: Component Composition
end-user/workflow/component-dependency-p.description: This section will introduce the dependencies in components and how to pass data between components.

end-user/workflow/dependency.title: Dependency
end-user/workflow/dependency.description: This section will introduce how to specify dependencies for workflow steps.

end-user/workflow/if-condition.title: If Conditions
end-user/workflow/if-condition.description: This section introduces how to add if conditions to workflow steps.

end-user/workflow/inputs-outputs.title: Data Passing
end-user/workflow/inputs-outputs.description: This section introduces how to use Inputs and Outputs to pass data between workflow steps in KubeVela.

end-user/workflow/overview.title: Overview
end-user/workflow/overview.description: Workflows, as part of the Application, can glue together additional delivery processes and specify arbitrary delivery environments. In short, Workflow provides customized control flow and flexibility based on the original delivery model of Kubernetes(Apply). For example, Workflow can be used to implement complex operations such as pause, manual approval, if conditions, waiting status, data flow, multi-environment gray release, A/B testing, etc.

end-user/workflow/step-group.title: Sub Steps
end-user/workflow/step-group.description: This section describes how to use sub steps in KubeVela.

end-user/workflow/suspend.title: Suspend and Resume
end-user/workflow/suspend.description: This section introduces how to suspend and resume the workflow in KubeVela.

end-user/workflow/timeout.title: Timeout of Step
end-user/workflow/timeout.description: Note: You need to upgrade to version 1.5 or above to use the timeout.

end-user/workflow/webhook-notification.title: Notification
end-user/workflow/webhook-notification.description: This docs is converted to here.

getting-started/architecture.title: Architecture
getting-started/architecture.description: The overall architecture of KubeVela is shown as below:

getting-started/core-concept.title: Application
getting-started/core-concept.description: KubeVela revolves around cloud-native application delivery scenarios. The application delivery model behind it is Open Application Model, or OAM for short.

getting-started/definition.title: Definition
getting-started/definition.description: Definition are the basic building block of the KubeVela platform. A definition encapsulates an arbitrarily complex automation as a lego style module that can be used to compose an Application, then safely shared, and repeatably executed by any KubeVela engine.

getting-started/velaux-concept.title: VelaUX Concept
getting-started/velaux-concept.description: This doc has migrated to velaux addon introdution.

how-to/cli/addon/addon.title: Addon management
how-to/cli/addon/addon.description: The docs are migrated to user guide.

how-to/dashboard/application/bind-new-en.title: Bind Application with Environment
how-to/dashboard/application/bind-new-en.description: We can specify bind with one or more environments before deploy.

how-to/dashboard/application/create-appl.title: UI Console Operations
how-to/dashboard/application/create-appl.description: lifecycle of an application by kubevela dashboard

how-to/dashboard/application/delete-appl.title: Delete Application
how-to/dashboard/application/delete-appl.description: delete an application by KubeVela dashboard

how-to/dashboard/application/deploy-appl.title: Deploy Application
how-to/dashboard/application/deploy-appl.description: deploy an application to environment by KubeVela dashboard

how-to/dashboard/application/recycle-env.title: Recycle Application Instance
how-to/dashboard/application/recycle-env.description: When you want to delete the application instance in some environment, you can click the Recycle button in that environment.

how-to/dashboard/application/view-applic.title: View Resources List Created
how-to/dashboard/application/view-applic.description: If you want to learn the resources created by the applications, you can open the environment status page.

how-to/dashboard/target/overview.title: Manage Clusters on UI Console
how-to/dashboard/target/overview.description: This docs requires you to have velaux installed.

how-to/dashboard/trigger/overview.title: Triggers
how-to/dashboard/trigger/overview.description: Integrate with CI system by Triggers

how-to/dashboard/user/project.title: Project Management
how-to/dashboard/user/project.description: Project provides a logical separation of applicationsenvironments and delivery targets, this is helpful when VelaUX is used by multiple teams. Project can provide the following features:

how-to/dashboard/user/rbac.title: VelaUX RBAC
how-to/dashboard/user/rbac.description: The RBAC feature enabled restriction of access to VelaUX resources. The UI and API could strict permission verification. We designed platform-scope roles and project-scope roles, Each role can be bound to a set of permission policies, and users can obtain corresponding permissions when they are bound to the role.

how-to/dashboard/user/user.title: Overview
how-to/dashboard/user/user.description: Once VelaUX is installed, there's a built-in administrator user with full access to the system. It is recommended to use the admin user only for the initial configuration, then switch to another user or configure the SSO integration.

platform-engineers/addon/addon-registry.title: Build your Own Registry
platform-engineers/addon/addon-registry.description: An addon registry can be used for discovering and distributing addons. Currently, KubeVela supports two types of registries: git server and Helm repo.

platform-engineers/addon/intro.title: Build Your Own Addon
platform-engineers/addon/intro.description: The picture below shows what KubeVela does when an addon is enabled. There are mainly three process:

platform-engineers/addon/terraform.title: Extend Terraform Addon
platform-engineers/addon/terraform.description: Terraform Controller is the core controller to provision and manage

platform-engineers/auth/advance.title: Underlying Mechanism
platform-engineers/auth/advance.description: KubeVela introduces Authentication & Authorization for application delivery and management from v1.4. This article will deep dives in the underlying mechanism and demonstrates how it works.

platform-engineers/auth/basic.title: Kubernetes RBAC
platform-engineers/auth/basic.description: In KubeVela v1.4, Authentication & Authorization mechanism is introduced. This allows applications to dispatch and manage resources using the identity of the application's creator/modifier. With this feature, it will be easy to limit the access of KubeVela users/applications and isolate their living spaces, which will make your KubeVela system safer.

platform-engineers/auth/integration.title: Systems Integration
platform-engineers/auth/integration.description: KubeVela application natively supports impersonation even without the Authentication flag enabled. That means when the Authentication flag is disabled, you can manually set the identity to impersonate in the application's annotation fields. For example, the following guide will give an example on how to manually set the application to impersonate as a ServiceAccount.

platform-engineers/cloneset.title: Extend CRD Operator as Component Type
platform-engineers/cloneset.description: Let's use OpenKruise as example of extend CRD as KubeVela Component.

platform-engineers/cloud-services.title: Overview
platform-engineers/cloud-services.description: Cloud services are important components of your application, and KubeVela allows you to provision and consume them in a consistent experience.

platform-engineers/components/component-.title: Extend Cloud Resources
platform-engineers/components/component-.description: To enable end users to provision and consume cloud resources,

platform-engineers/components/custom-com.title: Component Definition
platform-engineers/components/custom-com.description: In this section, we will introduce how to use CUE to customize components via ComponentDefinition. Make sure you've learned the basic knowledge about Definition Concept and how to manage definition.

platform-engineers/crossplane.title: Crossplane
platform-engineers/crossplane.description: In this documentation, we will use Alibaba Cloud's RDS (Relational Database Service), and Alibaba Cloud's OSS (Object Storage System) as examples to show how to enable cloud services as part of the application deployment.

platform-engineers/cue/patch-strategy.title: Patch strategy
platform-engineers/cue/patch-strategy.description: By default, KubeVela will merge patched values with CUE's merge. However, CUE cannot handle conflicting fields currently.

platform-engineers/kube/trait.description: All traits in the KubeVela system works well with the simple template based Component.

platform-engineers/oam/x-definition.description: KubeVela is fully programmable via CUE, while it leverage Kubernetes as control plane and align with the API in yaml.

platform-engineers/openapi-v3-json-schem.description: For any capabilities installed via Definition Objects,

platform-engineers/openapi/overview.title: VelaUX OpenAPI
platform-engineers/openapi/overview.description: This section will introduce how to integrate VelaUX OpenAPI, please make sure you have enabled the velaux addon. Let's use port-forward to expose the endpoint for the following demo.

platform-engineers/policy/custom-policy.title: Policy Definition
platform-engineers/policy/custom-policy.description: In this section we will introduce how to define a custom policy with CUE. Make sure you've learned the basic knowledge about Definition Concept and how to manage definition.

platform-engineers/system-operation/boot.title: Bootstrap Parameters
platform-engineers/system-operation/boot.description: The introduction of bootstrap parameters in KubeVela controller are listed as below

platform-engineers/system-operation/enab.title: Air-gapped Installation for Addon
platform-engineers/system-operation/enab.description: If your environments don't have network access to https//github.com/kubevela/catalog, this guide will demonstrate how to install in the air-gapped environment.

platform-engineers/system-operation/mana.title: Lifecycle of Managed Cluster
platform-engineers/system-operation/mana.description: This section will introduce the lifecycle of managed clusters.

platform-engineers/system-operation/migr.title: Migrate from Old Versions
platform-engineers/system-operation/migr.description: This doc aims to provide a migration guide from old versions to the new ones without disturb the running business. However scenarios are different from each other, we strongly recommend you to test the migration with a simulation environment before real migration for your production.

platform-engineers/system-operation/obse.title: Observability
platform-engineers/system-operation/obse.description: The Observability addon provides system-level monitoring for KubeVela core and business-level monitoring for applications

platform-engineers/system-operation/offl.title: Air-gapped Installation
platform-engineers/system-operation/offl.description: velad provides the air-gapped installation experience, it's now the default installation guide.

platform-engineers/system-operation/vela.title: Vela CLI Docker Image
platform-engineers/system-operation/vela.description: This topic describes how to run, version control, and configure the Vela CLI on Docker. For more information on how to use Docker, see Docker's documentation.

platform-engineers/system-operation/work.title: Working with OCM
platform-engineers/system-operation/work.description: Open Cluster Management (OCM) is a powerful multi-cluster tool which allows you to connect your managed clusters to the control plane, even if the managed cluster is not directly accessible from the control plane. It is especially useful when your managed clusters and your control plane locate in different VPCs.

platform-engineers/traits/advanced.title: Advanced Features
platform-engineers/traits/advanced.description: It's migrated to the trait definition docs.

platform-engineers/traits/customize-trai.title: Trait Definition
platform-engineers/traits/customize-trai.description: In this section we will introduce how to define a custom trait with CUE. Make sure you've learned the basic knowledge about Definition Concept and how to manage definition.

platform-engineers/traits/patch-trait.title: Patch in the Definitions
platform-engineers/traits/patch-trait.description: When we are writing the definition, sometimes we need to patch to the corresponding component or traits. We can use the patch capability when you're writing trait definitions or workflow step definitions.

platform-engineers/traits/status.title: Define Health for Definition
platform-engineers/traits/status.description: This documentation will explain how to achieve status write back by using CUE templates in definition objects.

platform-engineers/workflow/cue-actions.title: Built-in Workflow Operations
platform-engineers/workflow/cue-actions.description: This documentation will introduce the CUE operations provided in vela/op stdlib package that can be used in each workflow step.

platform-engineers/workflow/working-mech.title: Workflow Working Mechanism
platform-engineers/workflow/working-mech.description: This document will give a brief introduction to the core mechanisms of KubeVela Workflow.

platform-engineers/x-def-version.title: Version Control for Definition
platform-engineers/x-def-version.description: A better version control management is comming in v1.5, refer to this issue to learn the progress.

quick-start.title: Deploy First Application
quick-start.description: Before starting, please confirm that you've installed KubeVela and enabled the VelaUX addon according to the installation guide.

quick-start-appfile.title: Overview
quick-start-appfile.description: To achieve best user experience for your platform, we recommend platform builders to create simple and user friendly UI for end users instead of exposing full platform level details to them. Some common practices include building GUI console, adopting DSL, or creating a user friendly command line tool.

reference/addons/ai.title: Machine Learning
reference/addons/ai.description: Machine learning addon is divided into model-training addon and model-serving addon. Run the following command to install the addon:

reference/addons/cert-manager.title: cert-manager
reference/addons/cert-manager.description: This addon is for cert-manager, which is managing the kubernetes certificates.

reference/addons/chartmuseum.title: ChartMuseum
reference/addons/chartmuseum.description: ChartMuseum is an open-source Helm Chart Repository server written in Go (Golang), with support for cloud storage backends, including Google Cloud Storage, Amazon S3, Microsoft Azure Blob Storage, Alibaba Cloud OSS Storage, Openstack Object Storage, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage, Baidu Cloud BOS Storage, Tencent Cloud Object Storage, Netease Cloud NOS Storage, DigitalOcean Spaces, Minio, and etcd.

reference/addons/dex.title: dex
reference/addons/dex.description: This addon provides dex login for VelaUX.

reference/addons/flink-kubernetes-operat.title: Flink-kubernetes-operator
reference/addons/flink-kubernetes-operat.description: A Kubernetes operator for Apache Flink(https://github.com/apache/flink-kubernetes-operator), it allows users to manage Flink applications and their lifecycle through native k8s tooling like kubectl.

reference/addons/fluxcd.title: FluxCD
reference/addons/fluxcd.description: This addon is built based FluxCD

reference/addons/kruise-rollout.title: kruise-rollout
reference/addons/kruise-rollout.description: Kruise Rollout addon provides canary release capabilities for Kubernetes Deployment, Statefulset and OpenKruise CloneSet.

reference/addons/kubevela-io.title: KubeVela.io
reference/addons/kubevela-io.description: This addon is the document website, align with https//kubevela.net/ .

reference/addons/netlify.title: netlify
reference/addons/netlify.description: - Netlify is a SaaS platform that can serve website especially for frontend service, it provides free allowances that was pretty cool to be used for demo and test. We can create an addon which provides a netlify component type for frontend service.

reference/addons/nginx-ingress-controlle.title: Nginx Ingress Controller
reference/addons/nginx-ingress-controlle.description: Nginx Ingress controller is an Ingress controller for Kubernetes using NGINX as a reverse proxy and load balancer.

reference/addons/ocm-gateway-manager-add.title: OCM Cluster-Gateway Manager
reference/addons/ocm-gateway-manager-add.description: TL;DR: "OCM Cluster-Gateway Manager" addon installs an operator component

reference/addons/ocm-hub-control-plane.title: OCM Cluster-Gateway Manager
reference/addons/ocm-hub-control-plane.description: TL;DR: "OCM Cluster-Gateway Manager" addon installs an operator component

reference/addons/pyroscope.title: Pyroscope
reference/addons/pyroscope.description: Pyroscope is an open source platform, consisting of server and agent. It allows the user to collect, store, and query the profiling data in a CPU and disk efficient way.

reference/addons/rollout.title: Rollout
reference/addons/rollout.description: This section will introduce how to use Rollout Trait to perform a rolling update on Component.

reference/addons/terraform.title: Terraform
reference/addons/terraform.description: To provision cloud resources, you can use terraform along with related cloud provider addons.

reference/addons/traefik.title: Traefik
reference/addons/traefik.description: Traefik is a modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer made to deploy microservices with ease. you can use this addon as a cluster gateway or a microservices gateway.

reference/topology-rule.title: Resource Topology
reference/topology-rule.description: The resource topology graph of VelaUX can automatically show the resource tree of an application for any workloads including Helm charts and cloud resources.

reference/ui-schema.title: UX of Definition
reference/ui-schema.description: VelaUX uses the UI-Schema specification to customize UI elements of components, workflow steps, and operation and maintenance feature resources, in the case of variable input parameters, to achieve a more native UI experience.

reference/user-improvement-plan.title: User Improvement Plan
reference/user-improvement-plan.description: Welcome to join the "User Improvement Plan"! To improve the KubeVela open source product, avoid bugs and improve the product quality, we need to collect some of your system and usage information.

tutorials/access-application.title: Access the application
tutorials/access-application.description: After deploying the application, the next station is publishing your service.

tutorials/consume-cloud-services.title: Deploy Cloud Services
tutorials/consume-cloud-services.description: KubeVela efficiently and securely integrates different types of cloud resources in hybrid/multi-cloud environments.

tutorials/helm.title: Deploy Helm Chart
tutorials/helm.description: This section introduces how you deploy Helm Chart.

tutorials/helm-multi-cluster.title: Multi Cluster Delivery
tutorials/helm-multi-cluster.description: This doc has been migrated to this blog.

tutorials/k8s-object.title: Deploy Kubernetes Objects
tutorials/k8s-object.description: This section introduces that how you can deploy Kubernetes objects into multi environments and clusters.

tutorials/scaler.title: Modify Replicas
tutorials/scaler.description: This article introduces how KubeVela adjusts the number of application copies.

tutorials/webservice.title: Deploy Container Image
tutorials/webservice.description: deploy the business application by kubevela

tutorials/workflows.title: Manage Workflow
tutorials/workflows.description: This article introduces the usage of Workflow and gives you a full picture of it.
